context: Back in America the scene had still not progressed beyond a small number of clubs in Chicago, Detroit, Newark and New York City. However, many independent Chicago-based record labels were making appearances on the Dance Chart with their releases. In the UK, any house song released by a Chicago-based label was routinely considered a must play at many clubs playing house music. <a0_0><b5_0>Paradise Garage<b5_0/><a0_0/> in New York City was still a top club. His cover of Class Action's Larry Levan mixed "<a2_0><b7_0>Weekend<b7_0/><a2_0/>" demonstrated the continuum from the underground disco to a new house sound with <a3_0><b8_0>hip-hop influences<b8_0/><a3_0/> evident in the quicker sampling and the <a4_0><b9_0>more rugged<b9_0/><a4_0/> bass-line.
